Description: Egyptian terracotta figure of male cult follower wearing festival wreath headdress in ‘grotesque’ style. Head only. Mould-made and hollow. Traces of white and pink paint. Red-brown Nile silt fabric.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Probably locally produced at the Naukratis terracottas workshop that was operational between the 3rd to the 2nd century BC and possibly later. Two 2nd century BC parallels from Tell Atrib (Szymańska 2005, nos.133-4). Szymańska, H. 2005, Terres cuites d’Athribis, Turnhout.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.532) (phase 3)
